availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lydia Smith Viley (Fayette County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Willa J. Viley. Mother of Anne Eliza Viley, Warren Viley, Andrew Jackson Viley and Maria Viley. Resident of Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Lived in household that owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Resident of Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 454. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 30. Find A Grave, "Lydia Smith Viley (1794-1869)," Memorial #98984794, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98984794/lydia-viley (accessed January 22, 2018).
